_comment: Mapping of error code prefixes to API modules/services. Used for determining the origin and handling strategy for different error types.

AUTH.description: Errors related to user authentication, authorization, or session management.
AUTH.handling_strategy: Retry with re-authentication if possible, otherwise log and return a 401 Unauthorized error.

USER.description: Errors related to user creation, modification, or deletion.
USER.handling_strategy: Return a 400 Bad Request error with specific details about the invalid user data or operation.

PROD.description: Errors related to retrieving or managing product information.
PROD.handling_strategy: Retry a limited number of times. If still failing, log the error and return a 500 Internal Server Error with a generic message.  Monitor for widespread issues.

ORD.description: Errors related to order placement, modification, or fulfillment.
ORD.handling_strategy: Return a 409 Conflict error if the order is in an invalid state.  For other errors, attempt to automatically correct the order if possible, otherwise notify support and return a 500 Internal Server Error.

PAY.description: Errors related to payment authorization, capture, or refund.
PAY.handling_strategy: Return a 402 Payment Required error.  Provide specific instructions to the user on how to resolve the payment issue.

RATE.description: Errors indicating that the client has exceeded their rate limit.
RATE.handling_strategy: Return a 429 Too Many Requests error with a 'Retry-After' header indicating when the client can retry.

DATA.description: Errors related to accessing or manipulating data in the database.  Includes validation failures.
DATA.handling_strategy: Retry database operations with exponential backoff. If persistent, return a 503 Service Unavailable error, indicating a temporary issue.  Alert the database administrators.

INTEG.description: Errors encountered when communicating with external APIs or services.
INTEG.handling_strategy: Implement circuit breaker pattern to prevent cascading failures. Return a 502 Bad Gateway error if the external service is unavailable.

NOTF.description: Errors related to sending emails, SMS messages, or push notifications.
NOTF.handling_strategy: Queue failed notifications for retry. Log errors and monitor for persistent failures. Return a 500 Internal Server Error to the client, indicating a temporary issue with notifications.
